item.title: Lock-Free Data Structures: Concurrency Without the Wait
item.description:
Traditional locks have served concurrent programming for decades, but they come with costs: contention, priority inversion, and the ever-present risk of deadlock. Lock-free data structures offer an alternativeâ€”algorithms that guarantee system-wide progress even when individual threads stall. This post explores the theory, challenges, and practical implementations of lock-free programming.

1. Why Lock-Free?

Consider a simple counter shared among threads. With a mutex:

pthread_mutex_lock(&mutex);
counter++;
pthread_mutex_unlock(&mutex);
